summary: Bran is the only stark left whose had real experience ruling Winterfell and he’s the only true born son of Ned Stark left and...
question: Bran is the only stark left whose had real experience ruling Winterfell and he’s the only true born son of Ned Stark left and yet his rights to his home and his leadership skills are thrown away by D&D it’s so disappointing
answer:
Bran is the one who has spend more chapters than any of his siblings in Winterfell. During ACOK, he also ruled Winterfell while his brother, King Robb, was away at war together with their mother.  And while his sisters pick some interesting skills on their respective journeys never of them has any experience of ruling. Same can be said for Rickon, who is just a toddier (and alive, too!) on the book series.

Besides, as you mentioned, Winterfell is Bran’s by Westeros inheritance right. He comes first in the line of succession, before his two sisters and his younger brother. And honestly, I don’t see Bran, who in terms of responsibility resembles his father, giving up being Lord of Winterfell and/or King in the North just because he also acquired some magical skills along the way. I believe that’s purely show’s invention because D&D don’t really care about his character and anything that belongs to him (another example is the horrible way they treated Summer - which I also suspect will stay alive in the books).

I’ve written some more detailed posts about Bran and lordship here and here and also here.

blog.name: buttercuparry
blog.title: Warm Winter Sun
blog.description: If a 12 year old has to save the world then so be it!

tags: and let him be as he was
with all his warmth and kindness
summary: The stone is strong, Bran told himself, the roots of the trees go deep, and under the ground the Kings of Winter sit their...
body:
The stone is strong, Bran told himself, the roots of the trees go deep, and under the ground the Kings of Winter sit their thrones. So long as those remained, Winterfell remained. It was not dead, just broken. Like me, he thought. I’m not dead either -

ACoK Bran VII

Don’t mind me. I am getting emotional. I saw the aftermath trailer and I just couldn’t stop thinking about Bran. I know that the books are going to be very different than the show…at least I hope so and my only request to Grrm is to not let Winterfell fall.

summary: In a recent ask about Show Bran, you said the show's flashbacks concerning R+L=J showed a misunderstanding of Ned. Could you...
question: In a recent ask about Show Bran, you said the show's flashbacks concerning R+L=J showed a misunderstanding of Ned. Could you explain what they got wrong? A lot of book dialogue was cut out when he confronted the Kingsguard but I don't remember him saying anything particularly out of character
answer:
It’s the first Tower of Joy flashback that’s the main offender, here. The flashback to Ned as a kid didn’t really do anything, while the second Tower of Joy flashback was only a bit unclear. Aside from that I thought the second Tower of Joy flashback was pretty good, actually!

Back to the one I didn’t like, though.

First, the fact that this flashback was in season six at all. It belonged in season one. The Tower of Joy flashback, in the books, is there to tell us about Ned, as much or more as it’s meant to tell us about R+L=J. It tells us about Ned’s love for his sister, his traumatic experiences in Robert’s Rebellion, and shows us the massive emotional and psychological strain of keeping what’s hinted to be a huge secret. What the readers can piece together about Ned’s past in book one goes a long way to explaining why he resigned the Handship mid-book and why he couldn’t just tell Robert about Joffrey, Myrcella, and Tommen. The answer to those questions was not “because he’s too honourable (and kinda stupid).”

Second, making the swordfight the focus of the scene. We don’t see the fight in the books because the details of the fight…really don’t matter, thematically. The drama in that scene is Ned’s dead friends, rather than the action of Arthur Dayne mowing them down. It puts the spotlight on how badass!™ Arthur Dayne is, rather than the tragedy of the setup.

The fight choreography wasn’t even good enough to justify this decision. And by wasn’t even good, I mean it was marginally better than the Sand Snake fight. Arthur Dayne dual wielding, fine. Arthur Dayne dual wielding fucking longswords hamstrung the choreography. You can see the actors waiting their turn to die.

Thirdly, the twist ending of that swordfight. Bran’s all excited, because apparently Ned told Bran the story of how he defeated Ser Arthur Dayne a lot. Then, surprise! Ned did not defeat Ser Arthur Dayne in combat! Howland Reed ever so unsportingly got up after being knocked down in full on melee combat and had the temerity to defend himself and his friend rather than queue up nicely like the others to get cut down, and Ned reveals his own dishonour by finishing Ser Arthur off. Baffled as I am that Howland and Ned are apparently scumbags for taking advantage of Ser Arthur’s lapse of combat awareness (this was not a goddamned duel and everyone knew it going in), the fact that Ned repeatedly told a false version of events to his children tells us that show!Ned’s a lying braggart.

Show!Ned, by contrast, only ever told Bran that Arthur Dayne was the best knight he ever saw, and Arthur would have killed him if it weren’t for Howland Reed. Basically the polar fucking opposite of the show’s version of Ned’s narrative. And why? Apparently to destroy the idea that Ned was honourable. Goodness knows why the writers thought that was necessary, or even a higher priority than revealing to the audience the focal point of the trauma Ned suffered.

blog.description:
Daenerys was my first fave and she will be my last.

Danielle, US. Meera is the frog queen of my heart but I post more about my dragon queen Dany. Trying to be a happy person against the will of all these nihilistic men.

This is my ASOIAF/GOT side blog. My main is a-mountain-girl, my booklr is readingaway.

blog.name: asongofstarkandtargaryen
blog.title: Dracarys!
blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

tags: have a wall of text about an interaction nobody but me cares for
summary: I know most fans are focused on how Dany’s interactions with Sansa and Arya will go (because all these girls are popular...
body:
I know most fans are focused on how Dany’s interactions with Sansa and Arya will go (because all these girls are popular characters) but personally I’m also curious to see Dany meeting Bran and I hope these two will have positive interactions.

Bran sees the big picture and knows that the Night King is the real threat so I don’t see him acting petty towards Dany just because she’s a Targaryen or for any similar season. Perhaps, he has seen her in a future vision and he knows that she will have a big role to play in defeating their common enemy. But even if he hasn’t seen her in a vision, I still don’t think that he will be rude towards her- he knows they need all the help they can get and he’s a sensible lad.

Furthermore, Bran and Dany share some parallels (like having prophetic dreams for example) and this makes their meeting even more interesting imo. I know the show has turned Bran to a robot robbing him of his human feelings but Isaac has said that on season 8 he will be more like a human again.If he is anything like his book version, I can totally see Dany liking the youngest alive sibling of Jon. Because book Bran is so sweet, kind and basically everyone loves him. And Dany always likes those type of people and when she meets lovable kids she gets protective of them.So I could see her acting like that towards Bran as well.

And Dany always likes those type of people and when she meets lovable kids she gets protective of them.So I could see her acting like that towards Bran as well.
trail.content:
I know most fans are focused on how Dany’s interactions with Sansa and Arya will go (because all these girls are popular characters) but personally I’m also curious to see Dany meeting Bran and I hope these two will have positive interactions.

Bran sees the big picture and knows that the Night King is the real threat so I don’t see him acting petty towards Dany just because she’s a Targaryen or for any similar season. Perhaps, he has seen her in a future vision and he knows that she will have a big role to play in defeating their common enemy. But even if he hasn’t seen her in a vision, I still don’t think that he will be rude towards her- he knows they need all the help they can get and he’s a sensible lad.

Furthermore, Bran and Dany share some parallels (like having prophetic dreams for example) and this makes their meeting even more interesting imo. I know the show has turned Bran to a robot robbing him of his human feelings but Isaac has said that on season 8 he will be more like a human again.If he is anything like his book version, I can totally see Dany liking the youngest alive sibling of Jon. Because book Bran is so sweet, kind and basically everyone loves him. And Dany always likes those type of people and when she meets lovable kids she gets protective of them.So I could see her acting like that towards Bran as well.

summary: The Birds Chirp once More by AzraelGFG         |         Ch.03: The Request of a Brother and Uncle
title: The Birds Chirp once More by AzraelGFG         |         Ch.03: The Request of a Brother and Uncle
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
“What is it you want to talk about?” Sansa asked.

“I am leaving for war tomorrow and I leave Shireen in charge of the North. She feels a little nervous about and I wanted to ask you to help her with your experience.”

“Of course, I will,” Sansa said immediately.

“You two are the first and second in the line of succession as it is now. Should something happen to me and I don’t return I know you two will be great Queens and continue to lead the North wisely.”

“Don’t say that. You will return to us.”

summary: “Bran’s story arc is fantastic. He’s a disabled kid in the harshest environment, yet he doesn’t just survive, he triumphs. It’s...
body:
“Bran’s story arc is fantastic. He’s a disabled kid in the harshest environment, yet he doesn’t just survive, he triumphs. It’s such a great message. He’s not traditionally glamorous, he’s not an action hero, but he could save the world.”

this comment from an interview with Isaac Hempstead Wright is the only thing giving me hope that they haven’t fucked up Bran’s storyline, and that whole Bran-is-Night-King theory won’t happen and Bran will survive and triumph and help save the day and all will be well

Bran’s story is so important and tbh, to me, Bran was always the real hero of the story, he’s the one who can save us all

please don’t fuck up Bran’s story

summary: It’s CLEARLY no accident the most famous of the Starks are all named Brandon, including those who preceeded the Starks. Brandon...
body:
It’s CLEARLY no accident the most famous of the Starks are all named Brandon, including those who preceeded the Starks.

Brandon the Bloody, who slaughted Children of the FOrest

Brandon the BUilder, who built the wall.

Brandon the Daughterless, who had a rather infamous run-in with A King Beyond the Wall,

Ned’s Brother.

Old Nan suggests the Night’s King from the books may have been a Stark..perhaps even named Brandon.


A line.


“She had lived so long, Mother had told him once, that all the Brandon Starks had become one person in her head.” -Speaking of Old Nan.
